content:
I created a calendar event for the deep dive meetings:

https://calendar.google.com/event?action=TEMPLATE&tmeid=M3JsYmdkN2F0cjdtYXE0Z2ljYzM4Nm42NTQgNnU1cnJ0Y2U2bHJ0djA3cGZpM2RhbWdqdXNAZw&tmsrc=6u5rrtce6lrtv07pfi3damgjus%40group.calendar.google.com

I can add folks as invitees if that's useful to you, ping me.

hopefully I got the time right...

2022-03-18T09:00:00-04:00 for 90 minutes?
Yes
Are these open meetings?
Yes! Definitely yes!
does that mean the deep dive meetings are an hour earlier than the wg-traits planning meetings?
No, they're all the same. I think it might be different now because of DST
I kind of forgot about that until this weekend when it happened
ah, the US has dst a week earlier i think?
Maybe

nikomatsakis said:

I created a calendar event for the deep dive meetings:

https://calendar.google.com/event?action=TEMPLATE&tmeid=M3JsYmdkN2F0cjdtYXE0Z2ljYzM4Nm42NTQgNnU1cnJ0Y2U2bHJ0djA3cGZpM2RhbWdqdXNAZw&tmsrc=6u5rrtce6lrtv07pfi3damgjus%40group.calendar.google.com

I can add folks as invitees if that's useful to you, ping me.

please add me :)
done
Just to confirm, the meetings are still on Zulip, yes?
Yes :)
There won't be a video component or presentation?
There's a google meet link in the calendar event...
Correct. Not for today at least.
(If text-based doesn't seem to work, we might consider video in the future)
oh yeah, google likes to add those automatically
(deleted)
one thing about deep dive next week: I at least want to attend the compiler team meeting at 2022-03-25T10:00:00-04:00
so I'd only have 60 minutes here
I think this is a solid case to go over the variance PR?
That shouldn't take too long

/poll What should we cover for Friday's deep dive?
Subtyping and variance chapter PR (nomicon#340)
Summary of GAT progress and brief coverage of important implementation details
Chalk/librarification planning
Hey it worked :)
Please add new choices if you'd like, but be mindful that it should be something I have enough knowledge to reasonably cover (unless someone else wants to lead this week's deep dive)
@WG-traits ^
added https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-dev-guide/pull/1297 to the list :)
it's the kind of decision I'd like this team to be owning
Another thing to remember: we only have an hour on Friday, so be aware of that if it changes your decision
(we will certainly cover all the topics listed in time)
